data.title: House Antitrust Report Targets Big Tech Monopoly Power And Urges Breakup
data.text: Coercive antitrust intervention is the original sin of the administrative state, and its very presence is highly destructive of wealth. Never learning from its failures and aiming decade after decade at America's greatest innovators on the economic frontier, we deserve better from policymakers.

data.title: How Big Tech companies gain and maintain dominance
data.text: Democrats from a U.S. House of Representatives subcommittee issued a report on Tuesday detailing tactics it said four of the biggest technology companies used to gain dominant positioning in online search, advertising, social networking shopping and other businesses.

data.title: Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Google Are Monopolists, House Antitrust Subcommittee Finds, Seeks Changes
data.text: A House Subcommittee has concluded after a 16-month probe that four tech giants – Facebook, Apple, Amazon and Google — are monopolists and wants Congress to change antitrust laws to force the companies to split off businesses or make it harder for them to buy smaller rivals. Basically, the group needs to be reined in,

data.title: House Committee Seeks Breakup of Giant Internet Platforms
data.text: Oct.06 --  A House panel proposed a series of far-reaching antitrust reforms to curb the power of U.S. technology giants including Amazon.com Inc. and Alphabet Inc.’s Google. Bloomberg's Brad Stone reports on "Bloomberg Technology."

data.title: Trading the tech sector in light of antitrust probe: Mahaney
data.text: RBC Capital's Mark Mahaney on the tech trade. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Dan Nathan and Jeff Mills.

data.title: Congress' Big Tech investigation finds companies wield 'monopoly power'
data.text: A 16-month congressional investigation into Amazon, Apple, Google and Facebook has found that the tech giants hold "monopoly power" in key business segments and have abused their dominance in the marketplace, in a full-throated condemnation of the giants.

data.title: Apple's 'monopoly power' over iPhone app distribution gives it outsized profits, Democrats say
data.text: The 450-page report from the Democratic majority staff of the House Judiciary Committee focuses on Apple's control of its App Store, the only way for consumers to install apps or software on an iPhone, along with Apple's proclivity to buy smaller technology companies and turn them into features for Apple products.

data.title: House panel report likens Big Tech to ‘oil barons and railroad tycoons’
data.text: "Companies that were once scrappy, underdog startups that challenged the status quo have become the kinds of monopolies we last saw in the era of oil barons and railroad tycoons," the report reads.

data.title: Lawmakers Issue Antitrust Report on Apple, Alphabet, Amazon and Facebook
data.text: A House subcommittee on antitrust released a 450-page report on anti-competitive practices by Amazon, Alphabet, Facebook and Apple.

data.title: Long-Awaited House Report Recommends Breaking Up Big Tech
data.text: Democrats have criticized large tech companies for anti-competitive behavior.

data.title: This will be a long process, these companies may not be impacted: MS's Mike Wilson on Big Tech regs
data.text: Mike Wilson, Morgan Stanley’s chief U.S. equity strategist and chief investment officer, joins 'Closing Bell' to provide his insight after the House antitrust subcommittee released recommendations for Big Tech companies in regards to antitrust.

data.title: House antitrust subcommittee releases recommendations for Big Tech
data.text: CNBC's Kayla Tausche reports the House antitrust subcommittee released recommendations for companies like Google, Facebook, Apple and Amazon, which enjoy their monopoly of market share in the tech space. Some recommendations include structural separation of businesses and prohibiting them from being in adjacent-line of businesses.

data.title: House Lawmakers Condemn Big Tech’s ‘Monopoly Power’
data.text: In a report led by Democrats, lawmakers said Apple, Amazon, Google and Facebook needed to be checked and recommended reforming antitrust laws.

data.title: Congress says Facebook, Google, Amazon and Apple abused monopoly power
data.text: The report says the tech giants "run the marketplace while also competing in it."

data.title: U.S. congressional panel details Big Tech's abuses and urges tougher laws
data.text: A U.S. House of Representatives panel looking into abuses of market power by four of the biggest technology companies found they used "killer acquisitions" to smite rivals, charged exorbitant fees, and forced small businesses into "oppressive" contracts in the name of profit.

data.title: Congress should consider breaking up Big Tech and limiting acquisitions, House report says
data.text: Big Tech poses a grave threat to markets that might require breaking up the most prominent U.S. tech companies and limiting their acquisitions, concluded a House subcommittee report issued Tuesday.

data.title: House Democrats say Facebook, Amazon, Alphabet, Apple enjoy 'monopoly power' and recommend big changes
data.text: Republicans have voiced objections to some of the bolder proposals in the report, like imposing structural separations.

data.title: 3 Strategies to Buy Apple Stock Going Into Year End
data.text: The prevailing consensus is that investors should just own AAPL stock not trade it. To that I say -- it is more fun to do both.

data.title: Big Tech shares drop amid reports House subcommittee wants to split them up
data.text: Shares of Amazon.com Inc., Google parent Alphabet Inc. [GOOG], Facebook Inc., and Apple Inc. were down Tuesday amid reports that a House subcommittee that has investigated anticompetitive business practices for more than a year is set to recommend splitting them up and limiting the scope of their future acquisitions.

data.title: House panel’s probe into Big Tech reportedly draws skepticism from Republicans
data.text: A key congressional committee is poised to call for a crackdown on Big Tech companies — but some Republicans are already balking at its proposals, according to reports. The House Judiciary Committee’s antitrust panel is expected to release a highly anticipated report this week detailing the findings of its yearlong probe into the market dominance.

data.title: Apple Sets Date for iPhone Reveal
data.text: The company teased the event with the phrase "Hi, Speed."

data.title: Apple Set To Kick Off 5G Era With iPhone 12 Launch Next Week
data.text: Apple will officially kick off the 5G wireless era next week with its iPhone 12 smartphones, set for unveiling on Oct. 13. The consumer electronics giant announced the event on Tuesday.

data.title: Apple Is Under Pressure and May See $100 Before $140
data.text: Although AAPL stock has probably peaked for now, long-term investors in Apple may consider buying the dips. The post Apple Is Under Pressure and May See $100 Before $140 appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: House looks to break up big tech: Report
data.text: A House of Representatives subcommittee on antitrust will publish a report on Big Tech following a year-long investigation, according to Bloomberg. Yahoo Finance's Akiko Fujita discusses.

data.title: Apple’s new 5G iPhone keynote set for Oct. 13
data.text: Apple’s long-awaited iPhone 12 event will take place on Oct. 13, the company confirmed Tuesday. Next week’s keynote — which Apple teased with the tagline “Hi, Speed” in invitations — is expected to be dedicated to the first iPhones with 5G technology, which which will allow them to access a wireless network that promises faster.

data.title: Investors on what a new iPhone could do for Apple's stock price
data.text: CNBC's "Halftime Report" team discusses the possible impact of Apple's "special event," scheduled for October 13, and what they are investing in amid the coronavirus pandemic.

data.title: 8 Dow Stocks That Billionaires Love
data.text: Income investors who like the security provided by blue-chip stocks can look to the Dow Jones Industrial Average for ideas. Indeed, among the 30 Dow stocks, only three – newcomer Salesforce.com (CRM), Disney (DIS) and Boeing (BA) – don't pay a dividend.

data.title: Big Tech Stocks Fall On House Report Threatening Antitrust Action
data.text: Amazon.com, Apple and other Big Tech firms saw their shares fall Tuesday on reports that a House Judiciary panel plans to recommend antitrust action, including possible forced breakups. The post Big Tech Stocks Fall On House Report Threatening Antitrust Action appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

data.title: Apple's next online-only launch set for Oct. 13, 5G iPhone 12 expected
data.text: The iPhone maker's biggest event of the year shifts online as the coronavirus rages across the globe.

data.title: Apple announces 'special event' on Oct. 13 where it's expected to unveil new iPhones
data.text: CNBC's Josh Lipton reports on a new Apple event scheduled for Oct. 13, where it's expected to unveil new iPhones equipped with 5G.

data.title: Details of the House's antitrust probe have been leaked—Here's what we know
data.text: Details of the House antitrust subcommittee's report on Big Tech have been leaked. CNBC's Ylan Mui reports.

data.title: Apple will host Oct. 13 event that's expected to bring new iPhones
data.text: Apple Inc. AAPL, -1.33% will hold an online event on Oct. 13 that's expected to bring the launch of its new family of iPhones. The company held a virtual event in September during which it introduced new iPads, Apple Watches, and subscription bundles, though Apple didn't reveal its new iPhones at that time.

data.title: Apple announces date of special event, new iPhones expected
data.text: Apple Inc on Tuesday said it would hold a special event on Oct. 13, which most analysts believe will be used to unveil new iPhones with 5G capabilities.

data.title: Apple will announce the next iPhone on October 13
data.text: Apple just sent out invites for its upcoming hardware event, all but confirming the arrival of the next iPhone. The event is scheduled nearly a month to the day after the its last big event, which gave us the Apple Watch Series 6 and two new iPads.

data.title: Apple announces Oct. 13 event where it's expected to reveal the new iPhone
data.text: Apple announced the new Apple Watch Series 6, iPad Air and 8th-generation iPad during an event in September but the iPhone was absent.

data.title: If the Democrats win the Senate, Big Tech better be ready for a bigger fight
data.text: Democratic senators have signaled a willingness to make substantial changes to antitrust law and advocate breakups of the largest American tech companies, including campaigning for president on the issue. If the party can flip four seats, those same senators — such as Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota and Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts — could be in position to act against some of their favorite targets, including Facebook Inc. and Google parent Alphabet Inc.

data.title: Apple Limits Third Party Audio Device Sales Ahead of Launches
data.text: Apple (AAPL) stops the sales of third-party audio accessories on its retail website ahead of rumored AirPod Studio and low-cost HomePod launch.

data.title: Apple Boots Competing Hardware From Apple Stores
data.text: Beginning in late September, Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) began removing third-party products like headphones, earphones and speakers from its online store as the company prepares an announcement of new earphone and speaker products.

data.title: Apple Analyst Says App Store Revenue Growth Decelerated Last Quarter
data.text: The 2020 Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) rally ran out of steam in September ahead of the highly anticipated launch of the iPhone 12. On Tuesday, Bank of America analyst Wamsi Mohan said Apple App Store data suggests a growth slowdown in Apple’s fiscal fourth quarter, but the numbers were still fairly strong.

data.title: Key GOP lawmaker lays out 'non-starters' for Big Tech antitrust reform
data.text: The divergence leaves an opening for the powerful tech companies to oppose legislation that could install greater regulatory burdens.
